articles.title: Smokers have lower chance of surviving heart attack: Study - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The study has also found that levels of Alpha-1 Anti Trypsin (A1AT)--a protein in the liver that protects the body's tissues--in smokers were 'significantly less' than in non-smokers. | Health
articles.content:
A new study led by researchers at the Jordan University of Science and Technology has found that smokers have a lower chance of surviving a heart attack than non-smokers.
